metadata.Name: HotpotQA
metadata.Description: A question answering dataset with 113k Wikipedia-based question-answer pairs. It requires multi-hop reasoning over multiple documents and provides sentence-level supporting facts for explainability, allowing models to reason with strong supervision and explain predictions.
metadata.Paper Title: HotpotQA: A Dataset for Diverse, Explainable Multi-hop Question Answering
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 2018 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
metadata.Venue Name: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
metadata.Abstract: Existing question answering (QA) datasets fail to train QA systems to perform complex reasoning and provide explanations for answers. We introduce HotpotQA, a new dataset with 113k Wikipedia-based question-answer pairs that are diverse and require finding and reasoning over multiple supporting documents to answer. HotpotQA is also the first QA dataset that provides sentence-level supporting facts required for reasoning, allowing QA systems to reason with strong supervision and explain the predictions. We show that the state-of-the-art QA models perform poorly on HotpotQA, and the task is still challenging. We have released our dataset and a public leaderboard to encourage future research.
